newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore stocks seen steady despite U.S. job data.
newsitem.headline: Singapore stocks seen steady despite U.S. job data.

text.p: A slow start to the week was expected from the Singapore stock market on Monday despite supportive U.S. jobless rate data released on Friday, dealers said.
"Singapore will start slowly with Hong Kong closed. The U.S. job figures can lend some support but will not lead this market," said a dealer with a Singapore bank.
On Friday, the U.S. Labour Department said the jobless rate in May fell to the lowest level in more than 23 years.
The Straits Times Industrials Index ended Friday down 11.41 points at 2,032.30. Wall Street was up 1.79 points at 7,435.78. -- Angela Tan, Singapore newsroom (65 8703083)
